required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of IBI110 in Combination With Sintilimab Versus Sintilimab in Neoadjuvant and Adjuvant Therapy of Radically Resectable Non-small Cell Lung Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Open-label, Phase Ib Clinical Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of IBI110 in Combination With Sintilimab Versus Sintilimab in Neoadjuvant and Adjuvant Therapy of Radically Resectable Non-small Cell Lung Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: The main purpose of this study is to evaluate the neoadjuvant therapy efficacy of IBI110 in combination with sintilimab versus sintilimab based on pathologic complete response (pCR) rate in stage IIB (primary tumor > 4 cm ) to IIIB (N2 only) subjects with radically resectable NSCLC.

primary_outcome.description: defined as having no residual visible tumor cells in the surgically resected primary tumor and lymph node samples (ypT0N0)

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of serious adverse events (SAEs), treatment-emergent AEs (TEAEs) and immune-related AEs (irAEs)
primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 90 days after the last administration
primary_outcome.description: An SAE is any untoward medical occurrence that, at any dose results in death, is life-threatening, requires inpatient hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization, results in persistent or significant disability or incapacity, is a congenital anomaly/birth defect or is an important medical event that may jeopardize the participant or may require medical or surgical intervention to prevent one of the other outcomes listed before. A TEAE will be defined as any new AE that begins, or any pre-existing condition that worsens in severity, after at least 1 dose of study treatment has been administered. irAEs will be assessed.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with abnormality in vital signs
primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 90 days after the last administration
primary_outcome.description: Blood pressure, pulse, respiratory rate, and temperature will be assessed.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with abnormality in hematology parameters
primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 90 days after the last administration
primary_outcome.description: Blood samples will be collected to evaluate hemoglobin, mean corpuscular volume (MCV), white blood cell (WBC) count, platelets, 5-part differential white cell count, mean platelet volume and coagulation factors including international normalized ratio (INR), activated partial thromboplastin time (aPTT) and prothrombin time (PT).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with abnormality in clinical chemistry parameters
primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 90 days after the last administration
primary_outcome.description: Blood samples will be collected to evaluate sodium, potassium, calcium, magnesium, chloride, glucose, creatinine, urea or blood urea nitrogen (BUN), bicarbonate, amylase, bilirubin, alkaline phosphatase, aspartate aminotransferase (AST), alanine aminotransferase (ALT), total protein, albumin, lactate dehydrogenase and lipase.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with abnormality in clinical chemistry parameters
primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 90 days after the last administration
primary_outcome.description: Blood samples will be collected to evaluate sodium, potassium, calcium, magnesium, chloride, glucose, creatinine, urea or BUN, bicarbonate, amylase, bilirubin, alkaline phosphatase, AST, ALT, total protein, albumin, lactate dehydrogenase and lipase.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with abnormality in routine urinalysis parameters
primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 90 days after the last administration
primary_outcome.description: Urine samples will be collected to evaluate specific gravity, leucocyte esterase, nitrite, blood, bilirubin, protein, glucose, ketones and urobilinogen.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with abnormality in ECG parameters
primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 90 days after the last administration
primary_outcome.description: 12-lead ECG will be obtained using an ECG machine. Participants will be in supine or a semi-recumbent position (about 30 degrees of elevation) and rested for approximately 2 minutes before ECGs are recorded.

secondary_outcome.description: defined as time from randomization to any of the following events: progression of disease that precludes surgery, local or distant recurrence, or death due to any cause
defined as ≤ 10% residual viable tumor cells in the surgically resected primary tumor and lymph nodes
defined as free resection margins, systematic node dissection or sampling, and the highest mediastinal node negative for tumor
defined as the ratio of subjects who have achieved investigator assessed complete response (CR) and partial response (PR) per RECIST v1.1
defined as the time from randomization to death from any cause

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of randomization to 30 days after last dose of the drug
secondary_outcome.description: includes the positive rate of anti-drug antibody (ADA) and neutralizing antibody (NAb) in subjects

secondary_outcome.time_frame: from first administration of IBI110 to 3 days before the operation
secondary_outcome.description: Maximum serum concentration that IBI110 and Sintilimab achieves in the body after the drug has been administered and before the administration of a second dose.

secondary_outcome.measure: the area under the drug plasma concentration-time curve (AUC)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from first administration of IBI110 to 3 days before the operation
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the concentration-time curve from time zero to last measurable concentration (AUC)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: from first administration of IBI110 to 3 days before the operation
secondary_outcome.description: defined as the time it takes for the concentration of IBI110 and Sintilimab in the plasma or the total amount in the body to be reduced by 50%.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: from first administration of IBI110 to 3 days before the operation
secondary_outcome.description: a pharmacokinetic measurement of the volume of plasma from which IBI110 and Sintilimab are completely removed per unit time

secondary_outcome.time_frame: from first administration of IBI110 to 3 days before the operation
secondary_outcome.description: calculated by the amount of the drug in the body divided by the plasma concentration.

arm_group.description: IBI110 and sintilimab will be administered as intravenous (IV) infusion on Day 1 of each 21-day cycle (every 3 weeks) for 3 cycles during the neoadjuvant treatment phase. IBI110 and sintilimab will be administered as IV infusion 3 weeks during the post-operative adjuvant phase up to 1 year.

Sintilimab will be administered as intravenous (IV) infusion on Day 1 of each 21-day cycle (every 3 weeks) for 3 cycles during the neoadjuvant treatment phase. Sintilimab will be administered as IV infusion 3 weeks during the post-operative adjuvant phase up to 1 year.

facility.name: Tianjin Medical University Cancer Institute and Hospital
